meaningMnemonic: You know that 手洗い is "handwashing" (and also a not as polite way to mention a bathroom). When you add お you're suddenly making it polite. Why? Because you're talking about something a little more crass than handwashing. You're talking about the <vocabulary>toilet</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>restroom</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>bathroom</vocabulary>. Ewww. Poop goes there.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 手洗い, so if you know that you'll know this too!
